intro: Popowia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered popowia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often with five petals. It is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Popowia pauciflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological significance.
